snippet: South Carolina may render a brutal verdict on Mr. Bush’s campaign, and Mr. Cruz will face new questions about his potential if he is unable to broaden his appeal.
abstract: Political Memo; presidential candidacies of Jeb Bush and Ted Cruz are at stake in South Carolina primary, and failure to make strong showing for either candidate will make path to nomination prohibitively narrow.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Rock Hill, S.C., and Matt Flegenheimer from Greenville, S.C.

lead_paragraph: South Carolina may render a brutal verdict on Mr. Bush’s campaign, and Mr. Cruz will face new questions about his potential if he is unable to broaden his appeal.

headline.print_headline: Poor Showings by Bush and Cruz Could Do Lasting Damage to Their Campaigns
headline.main: Jeb Bush and Ted Cruz Have the Most to Lose in South Carolina
